activities.loc: MDB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:43 AM Defendant Jordan D Broaddus in court.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Jordan D Broaddus.  Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
COVERS 22CF214 & 22CF224
Attorney Erdman relates & waives further reading. 
Preliminary hearings both set before Judge Boyle. 
Attorney Erdman waives time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Jordan D Broaddus
Current: 1 E Eau Claire St, Rice Lake, WI 54868   (Effective: 11-02-2022)
Prior: 2136 20 1/8 Av Lot 91; Lakeshore Te, Rice Lake, WI 54868

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473. 

Must have no contact with C.H. or their residence.
Must have no contact with T.H. or their residence.
Must have no contact with E.D. or their residence.
Must have no contact with J.S. or their residence.

1:00 PM Defendant Jordan D Broaddus appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow appeared by video for Jordan D Broaddus for today only.  Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Address confirmed and phone number updated.  Qualifies for Public Defender.  1:04 p.m. Defendant and Attorney Rockow put in a breakout room to discuss bond.  1:06 p.m. back on the record.  Bond set.  AIA set and must appear in person.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
